TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/Window/SmallFrameBottom extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the bottom border of a small window. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.Window.SmallFrameBottom class gets a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the bottom border of a small window, such as a tool window.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Window.SmallFrameBottom.Active%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowSmallFrameBottom1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#361](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_97_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#361](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_97_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the bottom border of an active small window.
Docs.value: A that represents the bottom border of an active small window.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Active property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Active property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowSmallFrameBottom1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#361](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/bc73c6e8-44fd-4654-ac8e-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#361](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/bc73c6e8-44fd-4654-ac8e-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the bottom border of an inactive small window.
Docs.value: A that represents the bottom border of an inactive small window.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Inactive property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Inactive property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowSmallFrameBottom1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#362](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/19aec0b7-58d5-47ae-8dae-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#362](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/19aec0b7-58d5-47ae-8dae-_1.vb)]
